Toughest marker in the world. Im a usual 80 85 grade student and got a 63. Midterm and exams only specific answers are accepted. Demanding course. Not approachable.
Not good at all

Here's the deal. Prof is okay and if you actually pay attention to his lectures, you will find that he's not that unbearable or anything. Regarding the class, attend lectures and pay attention to the articles and points made regarding them. MEMORIZE TEXTBOOK AND KNOW YOUR ARTICLES AND ITS EASY!

The professor expects us to know the textbook extensively, yet his lectures only barely covers the material. At times he wastes one hour of lecture time ranting and not teaching the course material. Only one thing in his lectures that are important:articles. Personally I don't like the professor as I believe he is arrogant, but it is my own opinion

He is one of the most difficult profs to have, especially since you get him right in 1st year. He takes off 5 out 30 marks on your midterm if you don't put in your "form letter" on your scantron.... Just an overall scary, rude man, would not take any class with him ever again. Says don't just memorize but that's all you do in that class. POMPOUS.

He's good at teaching the course content in class, and going in-depth into the models that the textbooks discusses With that being said, the guy is a massive drama queen and will be sassy to you given the opportunity Course is easy, read the textbook ( a lot of reading ), memorize the articles he talks about in class, memorize the textbook, ez 75+

rComments: Do not take his class unless u have to. Nothing useful information in the lecture, basically u get all information from the book. This professor sucks.
The course itself is not difficult. Just study and you will pass. However, as for the professor himself, there is much to be desired.

Swanston is not a great professor; I'd place him right under Bailey for worst first-year prof. But success in his class can be boiled down to a science: -Read every word of the text. Just do it. -He links 1-2 articles each week. READ THEM. They are on the exam. -If he shows a vid in class, watch it and take notes. -Pray for a good bizcafe group.

A bit self-absorbed and condescending, but explains the material well. However, forcing students to pay $75 for an ebook that's updated every year is absolutely criminal. Boring lectures but stay awake, because your entire grade rides on three (3!!!!) things. The twist: one is a group project!!!

swanston is one shiny bald headed guy that purposely marks hard and wants you to fail so you could re take the course again and buy his 70$ e book that changes every year........... :)))

The most ruthless, racist and male-chauvinistic professor in UTM. Taking his class reduced my intellect. Self-promoter is what he is. Not the most difficult if you know what you're doing, but he's incredibly annoying, not too good at teaching, and the textbook is miserable to read

This is a memorization class, and an easy one to pass so because of this he makes it seem much harder than it is. Don't skip lectures, I thought it was strictly textbook for the tests & exam but he brings some topics from the lectures that are NOT in the textbook on the tests and exam. By far the worst Professor I have ever met. He doesn't care about anyone other than himself. Doesn't properly answer on student's question when they actually important. Poorly teaches the material due to his inability to communicate or draw student's attention during lectures.

started with an A ended with a B. Memorization heavy, not enough time for finishing all his tests. He makes everything harder than it actually is and tries to scare you. Must read articles and good idea to attend first half of lecture; that's where he gives his short answers from (articles). Memorize the textbook, should be easy A

His lectures are great, informative and useful. He connects textbook concepts with the real world news/stories to help students to understand. Bu his test are all rely on textbook heavily. teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things', 'Group projects']

rComments: This course is entirely memorization, it's an easy A if you can memorize. Also for BizCafe just do what StarBucks would do because people that did and they succeeded. Also, memorize the articles that he makes you read because the short answers always incorporate them.

Prof. Swanston is a great speaker, but isn't necessarily a great teacher. All of his tests (and exam) relied heavily on uncovered material, so get ready memorizing the whole book. He also tests people on discussed articles so take good notes. Bizcafe is a hit or miss. If you get a good group, great; if you don't, best of luck.

Professor Swanston gives very engaging and eye opening lectures. You rarely leave without understanding concepts because he often connects course concepts to real life examples like news stories and recognizable brands. As the course progresses, youll start to recognize his humour. Hes approachable and will help clarify any concepts during break.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: READ and memorize key points in the textbook. I found the questions or objectives at the beginning of the chapters were similar to test questions!!!!!!!!! He is a hard marker because he wants specifics from the book

Professor is always prepared and lectures are very organized in structure. Expects you to do the readings ahead of class (be prepared). Test structure is almost similar and the midterms don't differ from the final exam. Be prepared to work and do a lot of readings (a new chapter every week). The E-Book changes every year, so buy the newest.
- Good prof. Lectures are lively and discussion based -Tests are fair, based on readings plus assigned articles - A lot of subject matter. Stay on top of readings. Get them done BEFORE lectures

His lecture slides are not enough, you have to read every single sentence in the ebook. His midterms and exam are easy if you do your reading on time. Be ready to read a lot.
Really easy class if you read the textbook in depth and you study the articles. Take the group work seriously.

Prof Swanston is a great professor, he knows a lot, but his tests (multiple choice) may not be very clear. Look careful, that you fill in all the blanks, as it can result in -5 points. Group project was very fun, but you may lose some marks, because of your team's decisions. Many people are not attending his class, cause his lectures are useless.

He's one of the most respected teachers. He explains the materials really well and it's not compulsory to go to class but i always went because there are some video materials he play once or twice in a semester that MIGHT come up on a test and you can't get it if you do not attend class. He's an absolute gem. LOTS of reading to cover though
Unprofessional

Only a couple things! He may say otherwise but this is a COMPLETE memorization course. Know every inch of your textbook and you are good for the tests! rComments: Great lecturer with relevant business experience. The article discussions at the beginning of each class were a nice touch. However, a group project is worth 20% and can screw you over. Pure memorization course.

Dave Swanston is extremely strict and intimidating to students. On the 1st day, stating only 1 in 3 people get accepted into the management program. Read the textbook properly, sometimes things that seem insignificant end up on the Midterms. The group project can make or break your mark, try your best. You can lose marks if you dont read the instructions on the midterms well, you can miss little details. Not the worst professor in the world. Do the work, you'll be fine.

The course is literally all memorization, get notes and textbook from a previous year (because he hasn't changed textbook since 2012) and memorize. Lecs useless.

I took MGM 101 & 102, If you want to get a 90:  1. Take really good notes from the textbook 2. Memorize everything in your notes  3. boring guy. Lectures are dull and the content is pretty dumb in all honesty. Tests weren't too hard if you read the textbook and knew your articles. Suggestion:stay for the first half of the class and record the article discussions then cut.

First week of class: "I don't want you guys to memorize the material, just understand it and you'll be successful in this class"   Truth: M/c on his tests is almost always random terms and facts you have to memorize, and most of the short answer is as well. as long as u memorize and know the articles well you are good

He's alright, the simulation is pretty flukey and the testsexam were okay not too hard unless you do your readingsgo to lectures

He's good at explaining and expanding the material. I don't get why a lot of people are saying that he's boring. I guess you have to be interested in management if you don't want to die of lecture boredom.
This class was boring and I never went to lecture but very possible to get a 4.0. He knows a lot about his field, and some test questions have lecture material on them that is not in the textbook.
He's really boring and he basically doesn't add anything new. He just repeats himself every class unless there's an article or a case study.

101 was quite boring as great emphasis was on memorization and book. Also, I don't think the simulation was helpful to learn management. 102 was quite interesting as it emphasized on real life cases such as mount Everest and IKEA. Also liked the fact that he talked about recent news. 102 is great course for those interested in business. aa

101 was quite boring as great emphasis was on memorization and book. Also liked the fact that he talked about recent news. 102 is great course for those interested in business.
Extremely tough tests, class averages are in the 50's. Don't take this course unless you have to.

Honestly, i don't know why everyone is saying his tests are difficult, etc. Content wise, 101 was boring compared to 102 which i found more interesting. In terms of difficulty, all you need to do is focus on textbook material, memorize everything in the chapters required and you'll do well(Pay attention to guest lectures!) Overall, good professor!

When I look back at this course... It was actually very interesting, although the prof is boring.. To get a good mark, you really have to put a good effort especially in the boring lectures as he tests you on lecture content. And the markers are horrible! They don't know how to grade so make sure to have your test remarked!
Ridiculously boring professor. Tests were terrible and so dull to prepare for.
Lecture were dull.

Not a bad course, but not a fun prof. A heavy amount of your grade is in the hands of how others rate you, and a small disagreement between your peers can have them rate themselves as having done much more work than you. Many fellow students saw their grades fall from "peer evaluations" - which are a good idea, but terribly orchestrated
If you learn the material, you will do good in the course! You get the mark you deserve. He is a fair marker. However his simulation projects are annoying because there is so much work for them!
very consistent, know what he's talking about, fair with marks

Consistent prof who presents him self very professionally. Easy to approach although hard to get to know personally due to size of 1st year. Tests are quite fair, dead easy multiple choice, although short answers require some analytical skills on case studies. Overall an enjoyable experience.
cocky prof...vague marking...useless course...but hv to take it... i would prefer another prof for this course
A very F.A.I.R. prof.
